summary:
## Tennis Grand Slam

A **Grand Slam** in tennis means winning all four major tournaments (**Australian Open**, **French Open**, **Wimbledon**, **US Open**) in one year. It can be done by singles players or doubles teams.

There are also **non-calendar-year** (consecutive but not in one year) and **career** (during their whole career) Grand Slams. These tournaments are the most important and offer the most ranking points and prize money. They are overseen by the **International Tennis Federation (ITF)**.
title: Grand Slam (tennis)
